business.headline: How a change of name caused Bira a loss of Rs 80 crore. Check details Ahead of its IPO, B9 Beverages Private Ltd, the owner of Bira beer, changed its name to B9 Beverages Ltd, causing several compliance hurdles and sales disruptions.

New Income Tax Bill: 10 FAQs you should knowNew Income Tax Bill 2025 explained: The current income tax bill which was enacted in 1961, and came into effect in 1962, consisted of 512,535 words and 819 sections. On the contrary, the new bill consists of 259,676 words, 23 chapters and 536 sections.
Sensex, Nifty recover losses to end marginally higher amid volatilityThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 57.65 points to close at 75,996.86, while the NSE Nifty50 added 30.25 points to end at 22,959.50.

Regulatory body warns against rising NPS scams, issues these guidelines The Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) has cautioned subscribers of the National Pension Scheme (NPS) and Atal Pension Yojayna (APY) regarding fraudulent calls demanding money to release pension funds.

Government may set up reserve fund for stable EPFO interest rates: ReportThe labour and employment ministry is conducting an internal study to explore the creation of an interest stabilisation reserve fund under the EPFO, sources said familiar with the matter.

PM SVANidhi scheme: Know about eligibility and Rs 30,000 credit cardsPM SVANidhi scheme eligibility: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in her Budget 2025 speech announced providing credit cards under the PM SVANidhi scheme.

Is your money safe in co-operative banks safe? RBI's latest curbs raise concernConcerns over New India Co-operative Bank's financial stability and a potential Rs 122 crore scam prompted the RBI to take strict action. This incident has added to the growing list of cooperative banks facing regulatory action.

India Inc sees worst quarter in 5 years: What it means for stock market? The recently concluded Q3 earnings season has been the weakest for India Inc since the first quarter of FY21, according to a report by domestic brokerage firm Motilal Oswal.

Radhika Gupta on market volatility: Bad times don't last. Good investors doRadhika Gupta's advice comes as stock markets continue to witness a downward trend, with the sell-off in smallcap and midcap stocks intensifying.

Senco Gold share price tumbles 32% in 2 sessions. Here's what brokerages saySenco Gold stock price: The sell-off started on February 14 after the company reported its quarterly numbers showing profits plunged 69.3% to Rs 33.48 crore compared to Rs 109.32 crore a year ago.

Markets down, volatility up: 3 factors making Dalal Street investors nervousThe NSE Nifty50 has stumbled, dropping 3.2% in just eight trading sessions and slipping below the psychologically important 23,000 mark. The Sensex tells a similar tale of woe, falling over 3% to fall below 76,000.

TCS to issue hike letters soon; salary raise likely between 4-8%: ReportThe annual salary hikes at leading IT firms have gradually reduced over the years. In FY24, TCS employees received an average hike of 7-9%, while in FY22, the hikes were around 10.5%.

entertainment.headline: Bridgerton 4 first look: Benedict-Sophie's love story takes centre stageThe fourth season of Bridgerton is set to spotlight Benedict Bridgerton's romance with Sophie Baek. New characters like Katie Leung's Lady Araminta Gun will add intrigue to the season.

Legends of Shiva: Amish Tripathi gets real about Lord Shiva in his latest showAuthor and producer Amish Tripathi returns as host of Legends of Shiva with Amish, a new show on Discovery Channel, exploring Lord Shiva beyond myths. Unveiled at the New Delhi Book Fair, it promises a deep dive into mythology coinciding with Maha Kumbh 2025.

Amortage review: Jisoo's album shakes things up like an 'earthquake'Jisoo's new EP, Amortage, released on February 14, 2025, marks her evolution as a solo artist. The EP blends pop and R&B to explore love's many facets, featuring English tracks and her own songwriting.

Bhabiji writer Manoj Santoshi battles cancer, Shilpa Shinde takes care of himActor Kavita Kaushik made an emotional post on social media, highlighting screenwriter Manoj Santoshi's struggle with liver cancer. She also mentioned actor Shilpa Shinde and thanked her for taking care of him.

The Witch review: Jinyoung, Jeong-eui shine in slow-burning psychological mysteryReleased-Sat Feb 15, 2025The Witch review: The Witch, a new K-drama starring Jinyoung and Jeong-eui, captivates with its psychological mystery and slow-burning narrative. The series, based on a popular webtoon, blends mystery, romance, and suspense, leaving viewers intrigued by the enigmatic characters and their complex interactions, says our review.

Rashami Desai on love-hate bond with Sidharth Shukla: We'd communicate through eyesActor Rashami Desai, who had worked with the late Sidharth Shukla on 'Dil Se Dil Tak' and 'Bigg Boss 13', was reminded of her relationship with him on comedian Bharti Singh's podcast.

Stray Kids' Felix suffers fracture after car accident, misses group's fan meetFelix, a member of the boy band Stray Kids, suffered an arm fracture in a minor car accident, causing him to miss the band's fifth fan meeting.

South Korean actor Kim Sae-ron wanted to make a comeback to films, open a cafeSouth Korean actor Kim Sae-ron, who was found dead in her apartment on Sunday, had wished to make a comeback to the entertainment world, revealed a friend recently.

Gajraj Rao, Renuka Shahane's Dupahiya to bring laughter and chaos to Prime VideoPrime Video's Dupahiya is set in a crime-free village where the first-ever theft of a motorbike creates chaos and drama. Starring Gajraj Rao and Renuka Shahane, the comedy series starts streaming on March 7.

South Korean actor Kim Sae-ron, 24, found deadSouth Korean actor Kim Sae-ron, known for her roles in Bloodhounds and The Man from Nowhere, was found dead at her home in Seoul. She was 24. Authorities are investigating the circumstances of her death, with no signs of foul play reported yet.

The White Lotus S3 review: Predictable? Yes. Addictive? Also, yesReleased-Mon Feb 17, 2025The White Lotus Season 3 review: The White Lotus returns with a new season set in Thailand, offering a fresh cultural backdrop while retaining its biting satire on the ultra-rich. The series continues to entertain with its dark humour and ensemble cast, though its formula is starting to feel familiar. Read our full review.

Kanye West says he fought 5 hours for Grammy tickets amid guest list confusionRapper Kanye West, in a post on X, revealed that he fought for five hours to secure Grammy tickets amid guest list chaos. This comes amid claims that Kanye arrived at the event uninvited.

general news.headline: 'Leave ego aside': Congress demands Centre postpone selection of poll body chiefThe Congress accused the government of violating a Supreme Court order by including the Home Minister, instead of the Chief Justice of India, in the panel to select the Chief Election Commissioner.

Champions Trophy: First glimpse of India's jersey out, features 'Pakistan' imprintThe Indian cricket team unveiled their new jersey for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 which interestingly has the hosts' Pakistan name printed on it.

PM Oli reacts to Nepal woman student's suicide in Odisha university amid outrageNepal Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli addressed the death of Nepali student Prakriti Lamsal in Odisha. The Nepali Embassy sent officials to counsel students, offering them the choice to stay in their hostel or return home.

Why Elon Musk likes Genghis Khan, the conqueror who fathered hundreds of kidsTesla and SpaceX chief Elon Musk has always tried to conquer, be it the electric car industry or space, the final frontier. Musk has also fathered a number of children. His recent admission that he likes Genghis Khan shouldn't come as a surprise. The legendary Mongol was one of the biggest conquerors who fathered hundreds of kids, and is said to have his DNA in 16 million living descendants.
Qatar Emir in India, PM Modi receives him at Delhi airport in rare gestureBoth the leaders shared hugs and were seen chuckling as they exchanged pleasantries at the airport.

Bengaluru to be hotter than Delhi this year: Weather bodyBengaluru is experiencing record-breaking heat, surpassing Delhi, with a high of 35.9 degree Celsius on February 17, 2025. Warmer days ahead, suggests IMD.

Champions Trophy: Pakistan clarify Indian flag controversy after backlashThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has issued a clarification after India flag wasn't hoisted along with other nations on the the roof of the National Stadium in Karachi ahead of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

Five red flags Railways missed just ahead of New Delhi stampedeThe stampede at New Delhi Railway Station on Saturday claimed 18 lives. The tragedy, which occurred hours after signs of overcrowding at the station, worsened due to confusing announcements, inadequate personnel, and delays in several eastbound trains on a few platforms on the Ajmeri Gate side. These were the five red flags, if noticed and acted upon, could have saved precious lives.

Disease is not a joke, what's a stand-up comic got to do with it?Diseases are to be discussed at a symposium sponsored by big pharmaceutical companies where doctors fly in on tickets paid for by the big pharmaceutical companies. Is that Kashmiri comic a doctor, a pharmacist, or a journalist?

From dating apps to Dine-and-Dash: The rise of new-gen 'romance scams'Online dating is more popular than ever, with 62% of people using dating apps, social media, or messaging platforms to find potential partners. Half of those who met someone online have either been scammed for money or pressured into sending gifts.

Rahul Gandhi slammed for flying banned Chinese drone: 'Rules don't apply to him?' In a video posted on X, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi showcased a Chinese DJI drone which has been banned in India since 2022. He also acknowledged that "unfortunately, they don't allow to fly these in Lutyens Delhi".

Silent and sinister: How Akshaye Khanna's Aurangzeb stole ChhaavaAkshaye Khanna delivers a chilling, restrained portrayal of Mughal emperor Aurangzeb in Chhaava, standing out amid past cinematic depictions. His silent menace contrasts Vicky Kaushal's fiery energy, proving that true power doesn't always need words—just presence.

Nepal BTech student's death by suicide in Bhubaneswar college sparks big protestHundreds of students gathered on campus, chanting "we want justice", and accused the university administration of downplaying the alleged suicide case.

Wanted to clear debt before wife returned: Kerala bank robber confesses motiveA native of Chalakudy in Kerala's Thrissur confessed to robbing a bank to clear his debts before his wife's return from abroad. The police arrested him and recovered Rs 10 lakh of the Rs 15 lakh stolen.

Congress distances from Sam Pitroda's China remark: Definitely not party's viewThe Congress distanced itself from Sam Pitroda's remarks on China, stating they do not reflect the party's views. Pitroda questioned the perceived Chinese threat, calling it exaggerated. Congress reaffirmed concerns over China's security and economic challenges.

Watch: Man falls into gap between train and platform, rescued by alert copA Railway Protection Force personnel saved a 40-year-old passenger who slipped while boarding a moving train at Andheri station. The dramatic rescue was captured on CCTV, showing the officer pulling the man to safety.
A taste of their own medicine: Reciprocal tariffs will hurt US healthcare and howAbout 47 per cent of all generic prescriptions filed in the US were supplied by Indian companies in 2022.

In farewell speech, poll body chief flags 'misleading narratives' during electionsOutgoing Chief Election Commissioner Rajiv Kumar, in his farewell speech, alleged that the poll body is "unfairly blamed" by those "unwilling to accept electoral outcomes" and is perceived as a "convenient scapegoat".

'Life-threatening cold' warning as many US states brace for severe polar vortex A polar vortex is bringing life-threatening cold to the Rockies and northern Plains after winter storms battered the eastern US, killing at least 10 people. Kentucky saw severe flooding, with nine deaths, while snow and ice caused road chaos in the Midwest.

From weight loss to glowing skin: Experts reveal the best morning drink for youWith countless 'right' morning drink recipes online, the overload of options has only led to confusion—what to actually drink to start your day?

Turban thrown in dustbin, tortured in US detention camp: Deportee recounts horrorA 23-year-old man who was deported from the US to Amritsar along with 111 others on Sunday alleged he faced torture in a detention camp when he was caught entering the US illegally. He claimed he was in shackles on the deportation flight.

FIR against Ranveer Allahbadia, Samay Raina, others in Jaipur over obscene remarksA third FIR has been filed against YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia and others over remarks made on the show India's Got Latent. The Jai Rajputana Sangh in Jaipur lodged a case, and the investigation is being conducted by Khar police.

Bad dream to new dawn: Pakistan ready to welcome major ICC event after 3 decadesChampions Trophy 2025: Pakistan is set to host a major cricket tournament after nearly three decades, marking a significant comeback for international cricket in the country. Despite India opting to play in Dubai, excitement is high, with Pakistan hoping to host a successful tournament.

DJ Aqeel says 'whole world' was present at Abhishek-Aishwarya's sangeet partyDJ Aqeel shares experiences from performing at high-profile Bollywood weddings, highlighting the contrast between Saif-Kareena and Abhishek-Aishwarya's sangeet ceremonies.
Kriti Sanon begins shooting for Dhanush's Tere Ishk MeinActor Kriti Sanon has begun shooting for the Aanand L Rai film, Tere Ishk Mein, which will see her sharing screen space with Dhanush.

Legends of Shiva: Amish Tripathi gets real about Lord Shiva in his latest showAuthor and producer Amish Tripathi returns as host of Legends of Shiva with Amish, a new show on Discovery Channel, exploring Lord Shiva beyond myths. Unveiled at the New Delhi Book Fair, it promises a deep dive into mythology coinciding with Maha Kumbh 2025.

Ryan Reynolds, Blake Lively's first appearance amid legal drama with Justin BaldoniRyan Reynolds and Blake Lively made a notable appearance at SNL's 50th anniversary, drawing media attention amidst ongoing legal issues. The couple's presence was marked by a light-hearted exchange during a skit.

sports.headline: 40-year-old Afghan star dreams of playing with son, hints at extending career Champions Trophy 2025: Mohammad Nabi, who had announced last year that he would retire from ODIs after the tournament, has now hinted at extending his 50-over career. Nabi revealed that his dream is to play for Afghanistan alongside his 18-year-old son, Hassan Eisakhil.

Champions Trophy: First glimpse of India's jersey out, features 'Pakistan' imprintThe Indian cricket team unveiled their new jersey for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 which interestingly has the hosts' Pakistan name printed on it.

Neeraj recalls love story with Himani, says marriage was no surprise to familySpeaking to India Today, Neeraj Chopra opened up about his love story with wife Himani Mor. Neeraj tied the knot with Himani, a former tennis player, in an intimate ceremony in Shimla in January.

Neeraj Chopra Exclusive: Marriage, 90m dream and Arshad Nadeem rivalrySpeaking to India Today's Nikhil Naz, javelin star Neeraj Chopra opened up about his marriage, the 90m dream and his growing rivalry with Arshad Nadeem. Neeraj also spoke about the partnership with his new coach Jan Zelezny.

Champions Trophy: Pakistan cricket chief sells Rs 94 lakh VIP tickets for PCB fundsPakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Chairman Mohsin Naqvi has sold his hospitality box at Dubai International Cricket Stadium to collect money for the board's funds. He will be watching the India vs Pakistan game from normal stands.

'No surprise' as Delhi drop U19 captain Niki Prasad, field 5 overseas playersWPL 2025, RCB vs DC: Delhi Capitals dropped India U19 World Cup-winning captain Niki Prasad for the second game of the tournament. Nikki won the Player of the Match award in her WPL debut against Mumbai Indians on Saturday.

Kane Williamson to make his debut in The Hundred, set to lead London SpiritStar New Zealand batter Kane Williamson is all set to make his debut in the Hundred as he will be seen leading London Spirit in the upcoming season.

Spirited Bangladesh face uphill task without Shakib Al HasanChampions Trophy 2025: Bangladesh are without their premier all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan, but skipper Najmul Hossain Shanto said that the Tigers would be playing with the goal of winning the title.

Rohit Sharma is way better than Virat Kohli and Babar: Former Pakistan bowlerFormer Pakistan bowler Abdur Rauf Khan has called India captain Rohit Sharma way better player than his teammate Virat Kohli and Pakistan star Babar Azam.

Champions Trophy: Pakistan clarify Indian flag controversy after backlashThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has issued a clarification after India flag wasn't hoisted along with other nations on the the roof of the National Stadium in Karachi ahead of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

Kane Williamson to make his debut in The Hundred, set to lead London SpiritStar New Zealand batter Kane Williamson is all set to make his debut in the Hundred as he will be seen leading London Spirit in the upcoming season.

Spirited Bangladesh face uphill task without Shakib Al HasanChampions Trophy 2025: Bangladesh are without their premier all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan, but skipper Najmul Hossain Shanto said that the Tigers would be playing with the goal of winning the title.

Champions Trophy: Pakistan clarify Indian flag controversy after backlashThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has issued a clarification after India flag wasn't hoisted along with other nations on the the roof of the National Stadium in Karachi ahead of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
